info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 1:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rio Blanco County through 230 PM MDT... At 147 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles southwest of Rangely, or 51 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Rio Blanco County. This includes Colorado 139 between mile markers 43 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
